NLP Pipeline
  • Backend API (src/app)
  • View page source

Backend API (src/app)

This module implements the FastAPI REST service for interacting with the NLP7 pipeline via HTTP.

Main App

API_main.py.

FastAPI server exposing API endpoints for text, audio, and video.

class src.app.API_main.ErrorResponse(*, message: str, type: str, detail: Dict | None = None)[source]

src.app.API_main.clean_temp_uploads(older_than_seconds=1800)[source]

Delete temporary files in the ‘temp_uploads’ directory.

Parameters:

older_than_seconds (int) – Older files will be deleted. Defaults to 1800 seconds (30 minutes).

Returns:

None

src.app.API_main.download_csv()

Download the most recent CSV file with audio or video.

Download a specific CSV file from the output directory.

src.app.API_main.download_text_csv()

Download the most recent CSV file with text emotion prediction results.

src.app.API_main.predict(input: TextInput) → TextPredictionResponse

Predict the emotion of a given text string using a transformer model.

Parameters:

input (TextInput) – A JSON object containing the input text.

Returns:

Predicted emotion label, confidence, and path output.

Return type:

TextPredictionResponse

Parameters:

file (UploadFile) – The uploaded .mp3 or .wav file.

Returns:

Contains predicted emotions, timestamps,saved CSV paths.

Return type:

src.app.API_main.predict_from_url(input: MediaURLInput) → MediaPredictionResponse

Predict emotion from a media URL (YouTube, MP3, MP4).

Upload a video file to extract audio, transcribe, and classify emotions.

Parameters:

file (UploadFile) – The uploaded .mp4 video file.

Returns:

MediaPredictionResponse.

src.app.API_main.root() → dict

Root endpoint for checking API health status.

Returns:

A simple welcome message indicating the API is online.

Return type:

dict

async src.app.API_main.unhandled_exception_handler(request: fastapi.Request, exc: Exception)

Handle unexpected errors in the API.

async src.app.API_main.validation_exception_handler(request: fastapi.Request, exc: fastapi.exceptions.RequestValidationError)

Handle FastAPI validation errors.

Returns:

Details of the validation error.

Return type:

JSONResponse

Launch with:

uvicorn src.app.API_main:app --reload

Routes defined here expose:

  • / – Root

  • /predict/text – Text emotion classification

  • /predict/audio – Audio emotion classification

  • /health – Readiness checks

Model Loader

model_loader.py

Loads the fine-tuned transformer model, tokenizer, and label encoder used for emotion classification.

src.app.model_loader.get_model_components() → tuple[transformers.RobertaForSequenceClassification, transformers.RobertaTokenizer, object][source]

Return the fine-tuned model, tokenizer, and label encoder.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • model (RobertaForSequenceClassification): The fine-tuned transformer model.

  • tokenizer (RobertaTokenizer): Tokenizer for the model.

  • label_encoder (object): Fitted label encoder for decoding prediction indices.

Return type:

tuple

Loads trained transformer models and the label encoder from checkpoint-XXXX.

Prediction Logic

predict.py

Handles audio transcription, emotion inference, and CSV generation.

This module connects to the AssemblyAI API to transcribe audio, translates Polish sentences if necessary, performs emotion classification using a preloaded model, and exports the results to CSV files.

src.app.predict.format_time(ms: int) → str[source]

Convert time from milliseconds to HH:MM:SS,mmm format.

Parameters:

ms (int) – Time in milliseconds.

Returns:

Formatted time string.

Return type:

str

src.app.predict.get_output_paths(filename: str = 'final_predictions.csv', save_to: str | None = None) → list[pathlib.Path][source]

Generate output file paths based on the specified save location(s).

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – Name of the output CSV file.

  • save_to (str, optional) – Comma-separated list of target directories (‘output’, ‘desktop’, ‘downloads’).

Returns:

List of file paths where the CSV should be saved.

Return type:

list[Path]

src.app.predict.get_sentences(transcript_id: str) → list[dict][source]

Retrieve sentence-level transcription results from AssemblyAI.

Parameters:

transcript_id (str) – The transcript ID from AssemblyAI.

Returns:

List of sentence dictionaries.

Return type:

list[dict]

src.app.predict.predict_label(text: str) → dict[source]

Predict the emotion label and confidence for a given text.

Parameters:

text (str) – The input text to classify.

Returns:

Dictionary containing the predicted label and confidence. Or an error message if text is empty.

Return type:

dict

src.app.predict.process_audio_prediction(audio_url: str, save_to: str | None = None, language: str = 'auto') → dict[source]

Transcribes audio, classifies emotions, and saves results to CSV.

Parameters:

  • audio_url (str) – Audio file URL.

  • save_to (str, optional) – CSV save location(s).

  • language (str, optional) – Language code.

Returns:

Results and CSV paths.

Return type:

dict

src.app.predict.run_full_pipeline(audio_url: str, save_to: str | None = None, language: str = 'auto')[source]

Runs the pipeline and saves results to CSV.

Parameters:

  • audio_url (str) – URL of the audio file to process.

  • save_to (str, optional) – Location(s) to save the CSV file.

  • language (str, optional) – Language code for transcription.

Returns:

DataFrame of results and list of CSV file paths.

Return type:

tuple

src.app.predict.upload_audio(audio_url: str, language: str = 'auto') → tuple[str, str][source]

Uploads audio to AssemblyAI for transcription.

Parameters:

  • audio_url (str) – The URL of the audio file to transcribe.

  • language (str, optional) – Language code (‘pl’, ‘en’, or ‘auto’).

  • "auto". (Defaults to) –

Returns:

(language_code, transcript_id)

Return type:

tuple

Performs inference on user-submitted inputs.

Inference Engine

inference.py

Contains core inference logic for emotion classification and optional translation.

src.app.inference.classify_emotion(text: str) → tuple[str, float][source]

Classify the emotion of a single input sentence.

Parameters:

text (str) – Input sentence in English.

Returns:

Predicted emotion label and its confidence score as a percentage.

Return type:

tuple[str, float]

src.app.inference.translate_if_needed(text: str, lang_code: str) → str[source]

Translate Polish text to English if the language code is ‘pl’.

Parameters:

  • text (str) – The input text in Polish or English.

  • lang_code (str) – The detected language code (e.g., ‘pl’, ‘en’).

Returns:

Translated English text if input was in Polish; otherwise, returns original text.

Return type:

str

Routes text/audio through model pipeline.

Azure Client (Optional)

Optional cloud routing module to send requests to deployed AzureML endpoints.
